alert.note: Alert for Duplin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 8:18PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Duplin County through 900 PM EDT... At 817 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Warsaw, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warsaw, Mount Olive, Kornegay, Beulaville, Bowdens, Beautancus, Kenansville, Potters Hill, Albertson, Sarecta, Faison, Magnolia, Calypso and Lyman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
